awd_titl_txt: I-Corps: An Artificial Intelligence-Powered Mobile-Health Framework Providing Holistic Mental Health Support
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this I-Corps project is the development of an artificial intelligence-powered web and mobile application for mental health support.  Currently, the ability to deliver personalized, data-driven mental health care is a universal concern.  The proposed technology is designed to provide real-time stress analysis, customized geotagged resources, streamlined data management, optimized mental health referrals matching, and mental health tracking over time.  This is accomplished by offering services and securely linking users, employers, and community-based organizations (CBOs) based on users’ needs.  The application may provide organizations with a cloud-integrated dashboard tracking health resources for their users (e.g., employees, students), while providing insights into the use of resources, such as community-based organizations. The applications include K-12 and higher education, corporate workplaces, military, hospitals, and public health departments.  These customer segments could leverage the proposed technology to improve mental health outcomes.

This I-Corps project is based on the development of a mobile and web application that leverages artificial intelligence (AI) technology to address the need for behavioral health solutions. Existing systems often fail to deliver timely, personalized support to individuals dealing with mental health issues, leading to ineffective interventions and worsening conditions.  The proposed technology is designed to deliver real-time insights of a user’s mental health and stress levels, and offer an in-depth understanding of a user’s well-being. This may empower organizations, such as schools, healthcare organizations and corporations to tailor resources to support their users’ mental health needs. This research has identified a critical gap in the mental health support landscape, particularly with the lack of effective holistic and personalized treatment options. In addition, the proposed application is designed to deliver personalized mental health resources, analytics, and support to users. The technology integrates several intelligent frameworks that utilize natural language processing and machine learning techniques. The artificial intelligence resource matching framework may provide customized resources to users based on their input. The real-time stress analytics dashboard may offer insights into stress levels in real-time. The mental health disorder detection framework may enable potential early detection of these disorders.  The proposed technology may be used to address the rising awareness of mental health.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
This project focused on an innovative artificial intelligence-powered mobile health framework to provide holistic mental health support for K12 students and its commercialization. The outcomes address both the intellectual merit and broader impacts of our work in significant ways.

Intellectual Merit

Our team developed a cutting-edge mobile application that leverages AI and machine learning to deliver personalized mental health resources and support to K12 students. Key technological achievements include:

  • Development of advanced machine learning models to accurately predict user stress levels.

  • Implementation of a transformer-based approach for screening mental health conditions.

  • Exploration of Large Language Models (LLMs) to generate customized, safe mental health interventions.

  • Creation of a text simplification model to improve health literacy and information accessibility.

The application provides real-time analysis of students' mental health and wellness, offering schools valuable insights to foster a more supportive learning environment. It facilitates early intervention for behavioral health issues and delivers personalized resources tailored to individual student needs.

Broader Impacts

The project has potential implications for education, mental health care, and public health:

  1. Education: The application enhances personalized learning by adapting content to students' needs and preferences. It equips schools with tools to implement early intervention strategies and improve overall student well-being, directly impacting academic performance.

  2. Mental Health Care: By providing timely support to both users and mental health staff, the application is transforming mental health care delivery in schools. It facilitates early diagnosis of behavioral health issues and promotes preventive mental health care among youth.

  3. Public Health: The project addresses social determinants of health through tailored resources, potentially reducing long-term healthcare costs associated with untreated mental health issues.

  4. Social Work and Community Services: The application bridges the gap between mental health care and social services, enhancing community-based support systems for youth mental health.

  5. Data Science and AI: The project showcases the potential of AI and data science in mental health care, demonstrating the effectiveness of real-time data analysis in health monitoring.

Key Outcomes

  1. Stakeholder Engagement: We conducted 109 interviews with diverse stakeholders, including K12 staff, mental health professionals, and education officials. This extensive customer discovery process validated key market needs and refined our value proposition.

  2. Market Validation: 93% of schools interviewed identified increasing productivity of mental health support while reducing crisis events as a critical problem. Over 85% of interviewed school staff stated they would recommend or purchase software with capabilities similar to our application.

  3. Pilot Testing Partnerships: We established partnerships with three K12 schools in Michigan for pilot testing, involving students, parents/guardians, mental health support staff, teachers, and school administrators.

  4. Product Development: We finalized the Version 1 prototype of our mental health and wellness application, incorporating valuable feedback from early adopters for the upcoming Version 2.

  5. Research Dissemination: We presented our work at conferences in health informatics and biomedical data science, with a peer-reviewed paper.

In conclusion, this project has made significant strides in addressing the critical need for improved mental health support in K12 settings. By utilizing AI and mobile technology, we have created a scalable solution that has the potential to transform how schools approach student mental health and wellness, ultimately contributing to better mental health support and overall well-being for young people.

 


Last Modified: 12/01/2024
Modified by: Guy C Hembroff
por.por_txt_cntn:
This project focused on an innovative artificial intelligence-powered mobile health framework to provide holistic mental health support for K12 students and its commercialization. The outcomes address both the intellectual merit and broader impacts of our work in significant ways.


Intellectual Merit


Our team developed a cutting-edge mobile application that leverages AI and machine learning to deliver personalized mental health resources and support to K12 students. Key technological achievements include:




Development of advanced machine learning models to accurately predict user stress levels.




Implementation of a transformer-based approach for screening mental health conditions.




Exploration of Large Language Models (LLMs) to generate customized, safe mental health interventions.




Creation of a text simplification model to improve health literacy and information accessibility.




The application provides real-time analysis of students' mental health and wellness, offering schools valuable insights to foster a more supportive learning environment. It facilitates early intervention for behavioral health issues and delivers personalized resources tailored to individual student needs.


Broader Impacts


The project has potential implications for education, mental health care, and public health:




Education: The application enhances personalized learning by adapting content to students' needs and preferences. It equips schools with tools to implement early intervention strategies and improve overall student well-being, directly impacting academic performance.




Mental Health Care: By providing timely support to both users and mental health staff, the application is transforming mental health care delivery in schools. It facilitates early diagnosis of behavioral health issues and promotes preventive mental health care among youth.




Public Health: The project addresses social determinants of health through tailored resources, potentially reducing long-term healthcare costs associated with untreated mental health issues.




Social Work and Community Services: The application bridges the gap between mental health care and social services, enhancing community-based support systems for youth mental health.




Data Science and AI: The project showcases the potential of AI and data science in mental health care, demonstrating the effectiveness of real-time data analysis in health monitoring.




Key Outcomes




Stakeholder Engagement: We conducted 109 interviews with diverse stakeholders, including K12 staff, mental health professionals, and education officials. This extensive customer discovery process validated key market needs and refined our value proposition.




Market Validation: 93% of schools interviewed identified increasing productivity of mental health support while reducing crisis events as a critical problem. Over 85% of interviewed school staff stated they would recommend or purchase software with capabilities similar to our application.




Pilot Testing Partnerships: We established partnerships with three K12 schools in Michigan for pilot testing, involving students, parents/guardians, mental health support staff, teachers, and school administrators.




Product Development: We finalized the Version 1 prototype of our mental health and wellness application, incorporating valuable feedback from early adopters for the upcoming Version 2.




Research Dissemination: We presented our work at conferences in health informatics and biomedical data science, with a peer-reviewed paper.




In conclusion, this project has made significant strides in addressing the critical need for improved mental health support in K12 settings. By utilizing AI and mobile technology, we have created a scalable solution that has the potential to transform how schools approach student mental health and wellness, ultimately contributing to better mental health support and overall well-being for young people.
